trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight Reach SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight Reach SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate Azure Mobile Engagement Reach with Windows Phone Silverlight Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate Azure Mobile Engagement Reach with Windows Phone Silverlight Apps

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight Reach SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight Reach SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: You must follow the integration procedure described in the <link><linkText>Windows Phone Silverlight Engagement SDK Integration</linkText><title></title></link> before following this guide.
trans-unit.target: You must follow the integration procedure described in the <link><linkText>Windows Phone Silverlight Engagement SDK Integration</linkText><title></title></link> before following this guide.

trans-unit.source: Embed the Engagement Reach SDK into your Windows Phone Silverlight project
trans-unit.target: Embed the Engagement Reach SDK into your Windows Phone Silverlight project

trans-unit.source: You do not have anything to add.
trans-unit.target: You do not have anything to add.

trans-unit.source: EngagementReach references and resources are already in your project.
trans-unit.target: EngagementReach references and resources are already in your project.

trans-unit.source: You can customize images located in the Resources folder of your project, especially the brand icon (that default to the Engagement icon).
trans-unit.target: You can customize images located in the Resources folder of your project, especially the brand icon (that default to the Engagement icon).

trans-unit.source: Add the capabilities
trans-unit.target: Add the capabilities

trans-unit.source: The Engagement Reach SDK needs some additional capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement Reach SDK needs some additional capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Open your WMAppManifest.xml file and be sure that the following capabilities are declared:
trans-unit.target: Open your WMAppManifest.xml file and be sure that the following capabilities are declared:

trans-unit.source: ID_CAP_PUSH_NOTIFICATION
trans-unit.target: ID_CAP_PUSH_NOTIFICATION

trans-unit.source: ID_CAP_WEBBROWSERCOMPONENT
trans-unit.target: ID_CAP_WEBBROWSERCOMPONENT

trans-unit.source: The first one is used by the MPNS service to allow the display of toast notification.
trans-unit.target: The first one is used by the MPNS service to allow the display of toast notification.

trans-unit.source: The second one is used to embed a browser task into the SDK.
trans-unit.target: The second one is used to embed a browser task into the SDK.

trans-unit.source: Edit the WMAppManifest.xml file and add inside the tag :
trans-unit.target: Edit the WMAppManifest.xml file and add inside the tag :

trans-unit.source: Enable the Microsoft Push Notification Service
trans-unit.target: Enable the Microsoft Push Notification Service

trans-unit.source: In order to use the Microsoft Push Notification Service (referred as MPNS) your WMAppManifest.xml file must have an tag with a Publisher attribute set to the name of your project.
trans-unit.target: In order to use the Microsoft Push Notification Service (referred as MPNS) your WMAppManifest.xml file must have an tag with a Publisher attribute set to the name of your project.

trans-unit.source: Initialize the Engagement Reach SDK
trans-unit.target: Initialize the Engagement Reach SDK

trans-unit.source: Engagement configuration
trans-unit.target: Engagement configuration

trans-unit.source: The Engagement configuration is centralized in the Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml file of your project.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement configuration is centralized in the Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml file of your project.

trans-unit.source: Edit this file to specify reach configuration :
trans-unit.target: Edit this file to specify reach configuration :

trans-unit.source: Optional, indicate whether the native push (MPNS) is activated or not between and tags, (true by default).
trans-unit.target: Optional, indicate whether the native push (MPNS) is activated or not between and tags, (true by default).

trans-unit.source: Optional, indicate the name of the push channel between and tags, provide the same that your application may currently use or leave it empty.
trans-unit.target: Optional, indicate the name of the push channel between and tags, provide the same that your application may currently use or leave it empty.

trans-unit.source: If you want to specify it at runtime instead, you can call the following method before the Engagement agent initialization :
trans-unit.target: If you want to specify it at runtime instead, you can call the following method before the Engagement agent initialization :

trans-unit.source: You can specify the name of the MPNS push channel of your application.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the name of the MPNS push channel of your application.

trans-unit.source: By default, Engagement creates a name based on the appId.
trans-unit.target: By default, Engagement creates a name based on the appId.

trans-unit.source: You have no need to specify the name yourself, except if you plan to use the push channel outside of Engagement.
trans-unit.target: You have no need to specify the name yourself, except if you plan to use the push channel outside of Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Engagement initialization
trans-unit.target: Engagement initialization

trans-unit.source: Modify the App.xaml.cs:
trans-unit.target: Modify the App.xaml.cs:

trans-unit.source: Add to your using statements :
trans-unit.target: Add to your using statements :

trans-unit.source: Insert EngagementReach.Instance.Init just after EngagementAgent.Instance.Init in Application_Launching :
trans-unit.target: Insert EngagementReach.Instance.Init just after EngagementAgent.Instance.Init in Application_Launching :

trans-unit.source: Insert EngagementReach.Instance.OnActivated in the Application_Activated method :
trans-unit.target: Insert EngagementReach.Instance.OnActivated in the Application_Activated method :

trans-unit.source: The EngagementReach.Instance.Init runs in a dedicated thread.
trans-unit.target: The EngagementReach.Instance.Init runs in a dedicated thread.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to do it yourself.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to do it yourself.

trans-unit.source: App store submission considerations
trans-unit.target: App store submission considerations

trans-unit.source: Microsoft imposes some rules when using the push notifications:
trans-unit.target: Microsoft imposes some rules when using the push notifications:

trans-unit.source: From the Microsoft [Application Policies] documentation, section 2.9:
trans-unit.target: From the Microsoft [Application Policies] documentation, section 2.9:

trans-unit.source: 1) You must ask the user to accept to receive push notifications.
trans-unit.target: 1) You must ask the user to accept to receive push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Then, in your settings, add a way to disable the push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Then, in your settings, add a way to disable the push notifications.

trans-unit.source: The EngagementReach object provides two methods to manage the opt-in/opt-out, EnableNativePush() and DisableNativePush().
trans-unit.target: The EngagementReach object provides two methods to manage the opt-in/opt-out, EnableNativePush() and DisableNativePush().

trans-unit.source: You could, for example, create an option in the settings with a toggle to disable or enable MPNS.
trans-unit.target: You could, for example, create an option in the settings with a toggle to disable or enable MPNS.

trans-unit.source: You can also decide to deactivate MPNS through the Engagement configuration\<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: You can also decide to deactivate MPNS through the Engagement configuration\<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: 1) The application must first describe the notifications to be provided and obtain the user’s express permission (opt-in), and must provide a mechanism through which the user can opt out of receiving push notifications.
trans-unit.target: 1) The application must first describe the notifications to be provided and obtain the user’s express permission (opt-in), and must provide a mechanism through which the user can opt out of receiving push notifications.

trans-unit.source: All notifications provided using the Microsoft Push Notification Service must be consistent with the description provided to the user and must comply with all applicable <link><linkText>Application Policies[content policies]</linkText><title></title></link> and [Additional Requirements for Specific Application Types].
trans-unit.target: All notifications provided using the Microsoft Push Notification Service must be consistent with the description provided to the user and must comply with all applicable <link><linkText>Application Policies[content policies]</linkText><title></title></link> and [Additional Requirements for Specific Application Types].

trans-unit.source: 2) You should not use too many push notifications.
trans-unit.target: 2) You should not use too many push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Engagement will handle notifications for you.
trans-unit.target: Engagement will handle notifications for you.

trans-unit.source: 2) The application and its use of the Microsoft Push Notification Service must not excessively use network capacity or bandwidth of the Microsoft Push Notification Service, or otherwise unduly burden a Windows Phone or other Microsoft device or service with excessive push notifications, as determined by Microsoft in its reasonable discretion, and must not harm or interfere with any Microsoft networks or servers or any third party servers or networks connected to the Microsoft Push Notification Service.
trans-unit.target: 2) The application and its use of the Microsoft Push Notification Service must not excessively use network capacity or bandwidth of the Microsoft Push Notification Service, or otherwise unduly burden a Windows Phone or other Microsoft device or service with excessive push notifications, as determined by Microsoft in its reasonable discretion, and must not harm or interfere with any Microsoft networks or servers or any third party servers or networks connected to the Microsoft Push Notification Service.

trans-unit.source: 3) Do not rely on MPNS to send criticals informations.
trans-unit.target: 3) Do not rely on MPNS to send criticals informations.

trans-unit.source: Engagement uses MPNS, so this rule also applies for the campaigns created inside the Engagement front-end.
trans-unit.target: Engagement uses MPNS, so this rule also applies for the campaigns created inside the Engagement front-end.

trans-unit.source: 3) The Microsoft Push Notification Service may not be used to send notifications that are mission critical or otherwise could affect matters of life or death, including without limitation critical notifications related to a medical device or condition.
trans-unit.target: 3) The Microsoft Push Notification Service may not be used to send notifications that are mission critical or otherwise could affect matters of life or death, including without limitation critical notifications related to a medical device or condition.

trans-unit.source: MICROSOFT EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY WARRANTIES THAT THE USE OF THE MICROSOFT PUSH NOTIFICATION SERVICE OR DELIVERY OF MICROSOFT PUSH NOTIFICATION SERVICE NOTIFICATIONS WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, ERROR FREE, OR OTHERWISE GUARANTEED TO OCCUR ON A REAL-TIME BASIS.
trans-unit.target: MICROSOFT EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY WARRANTIES THAT THE USE OF THE MICROSOFT PUSH NOTIFICATION SERVICE OR DELIVERY OF MICROSOFT PUSH NOTIFICATION SERVICE NOTIFICATIONS WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, ERROR FREE, OR OTHERWISE GUARANTEED TO OCCUR ON A REAL-TIME BASIS.

trans-unit.source: We cannot guarantee that your application will pass the validation process if you do not respect these recommendations.
trans-unit.target: We cannot guarantee that your application will pass the validation process if you do not respect these recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Handle datapush (optional)
trans-unit.target: Handle datapush (optional)

trans-unit.source: If you want your application to be able to receive Reach data pushes, you have to implement two events of the EngagementReach class:
trans-unit.target: If you want your application to be able to receive Reach data pushes, you have to implement two events of the EngagementReach class:

trans-unit.source: You can see that the callback of each method returns a boolean.
trans-unit.target: You can see that the callback of each method returns a boolean.

trans-unit.source: Engagement sends a feedback to its back-end after dispatching the data push.
trans-unit.target: Engagement sends a feedback to its back-end after dispatching the data push.

trans-unit.source: If the callback returns false, the exit feedback will be send.
trans-unit.target: If the callback returns false, the exit feedback will be send.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, it will be action.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, it will be action.

trans-unit.source: If no callback is set for the events, the drop feedback will be returned to Engagement.
trans-unit.target: If no callback is set for the events, the drop feedback will be returned to Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Engagement is not able to receive multiples feedbacks for a data push.
trans-unit.target: Engagement is not able to receive multiples feedbacks for a data push.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to set several handlers on an event, be aware that the feedback will correspond to the last one sent.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to set several handlers on an event, be aware that the feedback will correspond to the last one sent.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we recommend to always returns the same value to avoid having confusing feedback on the front-end.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we recommend to always returns the same value to avoid having confusing feedback on the front-end.

trans-unit.source: Customize UI (optional)
trans-unit.target: Customize UI (optional)

trans-unit.source: First step
trans-unit.target: First step

trans-unit.source: We allow you to customize the reach UI.
trans-unit.target: We allow you to customize the reach UI.

trans-unit.source: To do so, you have to create a subclass of the EngagementReachHandler class.
trans-unit.target: To do so, you have to create a subclass of the EngagementReachHandler class.

trans-unit.source: Sample Code :
trans-unit.target: Sample Code :

trans-unit.source: Then, set the content of the EngagementReach.Instance.Handler field with your custom object in your App.xaml.cs class within the Application_Launching method.
trans-unit.target: Then, set the content of the EngagementReach.Instance.Handler field with your custom object in your App.xaml.cs class within the Application_Launching method.

trans-unit.source: Sample Code :
trans-unit.target: Sample Code :

trans-unit.source: By default, Engagement uses its own implementation of EngagementReachHandler.
trans-unit.target: By default, Engagement uses its own implementation of EngagementReachHandler.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to create your own, and if you do so, you don't have to override every method.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to create your own, and if you do so, you don't have to override every method.

trans-unit.source: The default behavior is to select the Engagement base object.
trans-unit.target: The default behavior is to select the Engagement base object.

trans-unit.source: Layouts
trans-unit.target: Layouts

trans-unit.source: By default, Reach will use the embedded resources of the DLL to display the notifications and pages.
trans-unit.target: By default, Reach will use the embedded resources of the DLL to display the notifications and pages.

trans-unit.source: However, you can decide to use your own resources to reflect your brand in these components.
trans-unit.target: However, you can decide to use your own resources to reflect your brand in these components.

trans-unit.source: You can override EngagementReachHandler methods in your subclass to tell Engagement to use your layouts :
trans-unit.target: You can override EngagementReachHandler methods in your subclass to tell Engagement to use your layouts :

trans-unit.source: Sample Code :
trans-unit.target: Sample Code :

trans-unit.source: The CreateNotification method can return null.
trans-unit.target: The CreateNotification method can return null.

trans-unit.source: The notification won't be displayed and the reach campaign will be dropped.
trans-unit.target: The notification won't be displayed and the reach campaign will be dropped.

trans-unit.source: To simplify your layout implementation, we also provide our own xaml which can serve as a basis for your code.
trans-unit.target: To simplify your layout implementation, we also provide our own xaml which can serve as a basis for your code.

trans-unit.source: They are located in the Engagement SDK archive (/src/reach/).
trans-unit.target: They are located in the Engagement SDK archive (/src/reach/).

trans-unit.source: The sources that we provide are the exact same ones that we use.
trans-unit.target: The sources that we provide are the exact same ones that we use.

trans-unit.source: So if you want to modify them directly, don't forget to change the namespace and the name.
trans-unit.target: So if you want to modify them directly, don't forget to change the namespace and the name.

trans-unit.source: Notification position
trans-unit.target: Notification position

trans-unit.source: By default, an in-app notification is displayed at the bottom left side of the application.
trans-unit.target: By default, an in-app notification is displayed at the bottom left side of the application.

trans-unit.source: You can change this behavior by overriding the GetNotificationPosition method of the EngagementReachHandler object.
trans-unit.target: You can change this behavior by overriding the GetNotificationPosition method of the EngagementReachHandler object.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you can choose between the BOTTOM (default) and TOP positions.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you can choose between the BOTTOM (default) and TOP positions.

trans-unit.source: Launch message
trans-unit.target: Launch message

trans-unit.source: When a user clicks on a system notification (a toast), Engagement launches the app, load the content of the push messages, and display the page for the corresponding campaign.
trans-unit.target: When a user clicks on a system notification (a toast), Engagement launches the app, load the content of the push messages, and display the page for the corresponding campaign.

trans-unit.source: There is a delay between the launch of the application and the display of the page (depending on the speed of your network).
trans-unit.target: There is a delay between the launch of the application and the display of the page (depending on the speed of your network).

trans-unit.source: To indicate to the user that something is loading, you should provide a visual information, like a progress bar or a progress indicator.
trans-unit.target: To indicate to the user that something is loading, you should provide a visual information, like a progress bar or a progress indicator.

trans-unit.source: Engagement cannot handle that itself, but provides a few handlers for you.
trans-unit.target: Engagement cannot handle that itself, but provides a few handlers for you.

trans-unit.source: To implement the callback, do:
trans-unit.target: To implement the callback, do:

trans-unit.source: You can set the callback in your Application_Launching method of your App.xaml.cs file, preferably before the EngagementReach.Instance.Init() call.
trans-unit.target: You can set the callback in your Application_Launching method of your App.xaml.cs file, preferably before the EngagementReach.Instance.Init() call.

trans-unit.source: Each handler is called by the UI Thread.
trans-unit.target: Each handler is called by the UI Thread.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to worry when using a MessageBox or something UI-related.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to worry when using a MessageBox or something UI-related.
